data.title: Poland vs Turkey Predicted lineup, betting tips, odds, injury news, H2H, telecast | International Friendlies 2024
data.meta_description: Poland national football team are unbeaten in the last seven games heading into this final friendly against Turkey before UEFA Euro 2024.
data.text:
These two teams will face off in their final friendly before the Euro.

Poland have made significant improvements heading into this match as they are unbeaten in the last seven games. They secured a dominant 3-1 win over Ukraine in the last match to maintain their good form. Biało-czerwoni will face the Netherlands in the opening match of Euro 2024.

They are drawn in Group D against France, Austria and the Netherlands, which is one of the toughest groups in the tournament. However, they can beat any opponent but must be wary of the threat their opponents pose.

Turkey haven’t been at their finest lately as the team have failed to win any of their last four matches. They recorded a goalless draw against Italy to mark an improvement before the Euros. They will now face Poland in this final friendly match as they prepare to take on Georgia in their opening Euro game. The Crescent-Stars find themselves in Group F alongside the Czech Republic, Portugal and Georgia.

Kick-Off:

Tuesday, 11 June at 12:15 AM IST

Location – Stadion Narodowy

Form:

Poland (in all competitions): W-D-W-W-D

Turkey (in all competitions): D-L-L-D-W

Player to Watch

Robert Lewandowski (Poland)

Robert Lewandowski is one of the finest forwards in the world evidenced by his goal-scoring record and prowess in front of the goal. Lewandowski currently plays club football with Barcelona, where he has scored 19 goals in 35 appearances while adding another 8 assists.

He possesses a remarkable record with the Poland national team having netted 81 goals in 149 appearances. He is their top scorer and has consistently proved to be the difference maker for the team.

Hakan Calhanoglu (Turkey)

Hakan Calhanoglu had a wonderful season with Inter Milan with whom he made 32 appearances. He scored 13 goals while adding three assists. He has impressed from the heart of the midfield for the team by carrying the ball forward and creating chances for the team.

Calhanoglu is a complete midfielder who does defensive duties excellently while chipping in with goals both from open play and from set-pieces as well, he is deadly in these situations.

Injury and Teams News

Poland will be without Arkadiusz Milik, who is ruled out of the Euros as well, after picking up a knee injury. The home team will likely aim to make some changes in this match to give some players a much-needed playing time.

Turkey on their part will be without Çağlar Söyüncü, Ozan Kabak and Enes Ünal as they have been left out due to injuries. The rest of the players will be available for selection.

Match Prediction for Poland vs Turkey

Poland are in excellent form heading into this match as they are unbeaten in the last seven matches. In contrast, Turkey have failed to win any of their last four matches. However, both teams have enough firepower upfront to score. We expect these matches to finish in a draw.

Prediction: Poland 1-1 Turkey
